types.html:
grand clerc m (plural grands clercs)

  1. (informal, figuratively) rocket scientist
    il ne faut pas être un grand clerc pour comprendre ça ― it doesn't take a rocket scientist to understand that, you don't have to be a rocket scientist to understand that, you don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows

Usage notes

[edit]
  • Not used with the definite article; either used with the indefinite article un, or without article (pas besoin d'être grand clerc pour comprendre cela).

See also

[edit]
  • grand prêtre

title: grand clerc
pronunHtml: • IPA(key): /ɡʁɑ̃ klɛʁ/
